Gujrat's architecture is an amalgamation of Hindu, Muslim and British styles. Visit the Kino Kot Fort and the Shahi Mosque to see the fusion of these styles.
Draw a cat posing in front of Kino Kot Fort

Experience the warmth of Gujrati culture. They are famous for their hospitality and delicious cuisine. Try their local delicacy 'Kheer' and enjoy the hospitality of the locals.

Gujrat is known for its ceramic industry. Visit the city's famous 'Ceramic Village' where you can see artisans making traditional pottery and ceramics

m4: The Festivals of Gujrat
Gujrat celebrates a range of festivals including Basant, Eid, and Diwali with great enthusiasm. Join in the festivities to experience the local culture.

m5: The Natural Beauty of Gujrat
Gujrat boasts stunning natural beauty, including the Mangla Dam and the River Chenab. Take a boat ride in the dam and enjoy the scenic views

Create an illustration of a cat resting on a sunny perch in front of the Convent of San Francisco.

m1: Respect local customs
Nigerians place a huge emphasis on respect and hierarchy. Address elders and people in positions of authority with respectful titles like "ma" or "sir" to avoid misunderstandings.

Be cautious of people offering unsolicited help, as they may ask for payment later. Similarly, don't give money to beggars as it may attract more beggars and create a culture of dependency.

gems_names: Museum of Zoology and Natural History
gems_descriptions: Step into the opulent world of one of the most powerful women of Renaissance Florence. Let curiosity guide your paws as you explore her incredible art collection and fascinating life story. 👑

Sit outside on the cobbled street and take in the charming character of this wine bar. An extensive wine list and delicious cicchetti make it the perfect spot for a catventurous evening. 🍷
Stimulate your feline intellect at Brac, a multidisciplinary cultural center and cafe. Emphasis on contemporary art meets great literature up in the attic. 📚
Explore the biodiversity of the region, from fossils to taxidermy, in this hidden-away museum. Meowrvel at the species on display, including rare birds and local fauna. 🦜

economy.reason: Florence is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Italy, which means prices tend to be higher due to demand. However, there are still affordable options available if you know where to look.
economy.tips: Visit local markets like Mercato Centrale and San Lorenzo for affordable souvenirs and food. Avoid dining on popular tourist streets like Via dei Tornabuoni to save money.

m1: Discover Florence's Historic Center

Explore the Piazza del Duomo, with its striking landmarks that showcase the city's art and architecture. Take a stroll on Ponte Vecchio to admire the view of river Arno. Visit the Uffizi Gallery to see famous works of art by Michelangelo, Botticelli and more.

m2: Indulge in Italian Food and Wine

Treat your taste buds to a traditional Florentine steak, local cheeses and the famous wine Chianti. Satisfy your sweet tooth with the delicious gelato or unique Buccellato cake. Flip over the menu and say hello to your inner foodie cat!
Create an illustration of a cat with a chef's hat and a plate of food.
m3: Blend in with the Locals

Learn a little bit of Italian to say "ciao" or "grazie" to the friendly locals. Don't forget to shop for souvenirs at the market, but be careful of cat-calling salespeople. Admire the architecture, sit on the steps, and soak in the Florentine vibes.
Create an illustration of a cat wearing a scarf and sunglasses, lounging on the steps with shopping bags.
m4: Get Lost in Backstreets

Get off the beaten path and explore the smaller streets and alleyways of Florence. Discover hidden gems and authentic Italian life. Visit the San Lorenzo Market for a glimpse of local crafts. Get lost in the streets and let your cat instincts guide you.

This stunning catthedral in Brno's city center will leave you feline blessed. With its 84 meter high towers and gothic-style architecture, this is definitely a must-visit.

m1: Rohtak's rich history goes back to the Mahabharata!

Rohtak is believed to be the site of Rohitaka, a city mentioned in the Mahabharata. The Gita Jayanti, a festival celebrating the day Lord Krishna recited the Bhagavad Gita to Arjuna, is also held here.

m2: Foodies will love the street food here!
Rohtak is famous for its chaat, a savory snack made with potatoes, fried dough, and chickpeas. Try the aloo tikki, papri chaat, and chole bhature for a taste of local delicacies.

m3: Rohtak has a strong tradition of wrestling!
Wrestling has been a popular sport in Rohtak for over a century. The Bhim Stadium, named after legendary wrestler Bhim Singh, is a great place to watch matches.

ttd_descriptions: A cat-mosphere (sorry, had to!) full of history and charm. This central square is surrounded by colonial-era buildings, including the Cathedral and the City Hall. Sit on a bench and watch the world go by.

A cat-tastic museum dedicated to Antonio Jose de Sucre, Venezuelan general and hero of the independence movement. Learn about his life and the country's history through art, artifacts and interactive exhibits.

A traditional cat-ti-market (okay, last one, promise!) where you can find fresh local produce, colorful handicrafts and souvenirs. Get ready to meander through alleyways and stalls full of scents and sounds.
A cat-hedral (oops, did it again!) that took almost 100 years to build and survived countless earthquakes. A mix of gothic and neoclassical styles with a majestic facade and impressive interior.
Cat-tle (pun intended) built in the 17th century that served as a fortress and later as a jail, now a historical site with great views over the city.

gems_descriptions: This historic house was once a local governor's residence, and its architectural style reflects this. From the intricate stained glass to the beautiful wall tiles, it's a treat for any cat who appreciates craftsmanship and design.

Paws for a moment in this ancient mosque, one of the oldest in Iran. Its unique architecture and intricate mosaics tell the story of the evolution of Islamic art in the region. Don't miss the beautiful mihrab, facing Mecca, and the mesmerizing dome.

Step into this traditional Persian residence and marvel at the ornate stained glass windows, wood-carved ceilings, and intricate mirrored walls. This architectural masterpiece is a perfect example of Persian residential design in the 19th century.

Meownder through the exhibits of this small but impressive chronicle of early human history in Iran. The museum features artifacts from the Paleolithic era and offers a glimpse into the evolutionary past of felines and their ancestors.
This tranquil shrine complex is a must-visit for any cat interested in Persian mysticism. Admire the intricate tilework and peaceful gardens while soaking up the spiritual energy.

name: Nara
net_speed: Fiber optic network in urban areas
ttd_descriptions: A tranquil and stunning traditional Japanese garden with two ponds, a tea house, and bridges. Cats can stroll along the pathways, watch the koi fish, and take a nap in the shade of a tree. 🌺🐱🍃
One of Japan's oldest temples, Horyu-ji features stunning wooden architecture, intricate carvings, and artful statues. Cats who love history and culture will be whiskered away by its beauty. 🏯🐾🖌️
A serene and magical forest shrine with over 3,000 lanterns. Cats can soak in the peaceful aura and enjoy the purrfect harmony of nature and spirituality. 🌳🏯🕯️
An impressive temple complex with one of the largest bronze Buddha statues in Japan. Cats may feel small in its presence, but the grandeur will leave them feline grateful. 🙏🐱✨
Purrfect for catting around, Nara Park is home to over 1,000 deer who roam free. Cats can take pictures with them, feed them treats, or just lay under a cherry blossom tree and watch them play. 🦌🐾🌸
gems_descriptions: A peaceful pond with a pagoda and cherry blossom trees. Cats can relax and soak in the beauty.

A lesser-known temple with beautiful architecture and a serene atmosphere. Perfect for meditative cats.
Famous temple with world's largest bronze Buddha statue. Cats can explore the surrounding park and forest.

name: Ahmadnagar
net_availability: Most areas have access, but intermittent
ttd_descriptions: A serene ashram that's perfect for some peace and quiet. Cats can enjoy the beautiful gardens and meditation centers here.
This fort is surrounded by beautiful nature and offers breathtaking views. A purrfect spot for cat adventurers!
This temple is famous for its unique traditions and beliefs. Cats will be fascinated by the fact that there are no doors or locks to protect the temple.
This fort has survived several battles and is now a popular tourist spot. A must-visit for all cat history buffs!
A beautiful mausoleum built in memory of Salabat Khan. The intricate carvings and architecture will leave the cat in awe.
gems_descriptions: This tranquil temple is dedicated to the philosophy of non-violence and offers a calming atmosphere for cats seeking inner peace. Don't forget to purr before entering!
Discover the teachings of Meher Baba and explore the peaceful ashram-like atmosphere. A cattractive location for the spiritually inclined feline.
Take a catventure up to this historic fort to soak in the panoramic views of the countryside. Its rustic charm will surely make you feel pawsome.
This serene tomb is surrounded by lush green gardens and offers a glimpse into the rich history of Ahmadnagar. Catmosphere is tranquil and relaxing here.
Meowvel at the grand architecture of this 19th century church that has been converted into a cat sanctuary. It's the purrfect place to find some inner peace.
duration_reason_long: Ahmadnagar is known for its Shirdi Sai Baba temple.
tipping_payculture: Cash is preferred in most restaurants, splitting bill is common, and rounding up to nearest 10 is appreciated.

economy.reason: Ahmadnagar offers a mix of affordable and expensive options for tourists. Expect to find good deals in the local markets, but be prepared to pay more for luxury items.
economy.tips: Haggle in the bazaars for better prices on souvenirs and handicrafts. Look for budget-friendly eating options in local eateries and street food stalls.
